cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles southwest of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the southeastern and central Gulf of Mexico toward the Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast between Intracoastal City and the Mouth of the Pearl River (near the New Orleans area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from coastal Louisiana eastward to Mississippi and Alabama; storm-surge watch extends westward to Sabine Pass, TX
weather_observation.wind: Low but notable chance (22%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds with gusty conditions possible late Sunday into Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible; Galveston is west of the official storm-surge watch area.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–3 inches of rain Sunday–Monday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents along the upper Texas coast.
